intro: Lampranthus algoensis, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and requires full sun exposure. Lampranthus algoensis is a short-lived perennial, often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance.
